Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleWrite.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleWrite.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    BleWrite
    public static final class BleWrite.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class to build out a list (or array) of BleWrite instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Builder()  
      Builder​(java.util.UUID characteristicUuid)  
      Builder​(java.util.UUID serviceUuid, java.util.UUID characteristicUuid)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<T> build()
      Builds, and returns the list of BleReads.
      BleWrite[] buildArray()  
      B next()
      Move on to another BleRead instance, based on the last one (so if you only need to change the char UUID, you don't have to set all other fields again).
      B nextNew()
      Move on to another BleRead instance, with the new instance having no fields set.
      BleWrite.Builder setBoolean​(boolean value)
      Set the boolean to write.

      Set the raw bytes to write.

      Set the characteristic UUID.
      BleWrite.Builder setData​(FutureData data)
      Set the FutureData to write.
      B setDescriptorFilter​(DescriptorFilter filter)
      Set the DescriptorFilter to determine which characteristic to operate on, if there are multiple with the same UUID in the same BluetoothGattService.
      BleWrite.Builder setInt​(int val)
      Set an int to be written.

      Tells SweetBlue the endianness of the BLE device you want to perform a write to.

      Set a long to be written.

      Set the ReadWriteListener for listening to the callback of the operation you wish to perform.

    • Method Detail

      • setIsBigEndian

        public final BleWrite.Builder setIsBigEndian​(boolean isBigEndian)
        Tells SweetBlue the endianness of the BLE device you want to perform a write to. This value only matters if you are using any of the convenience methods:

        setBoolean(boolean)
        setInt(int)
        setLong(long)
        setShort(short)
        setString(String)
        setString(String, String)

      • setWriteType

        public final BleWrite.Builder setWriteType​(ReadWriteListener.Type writeType)
        Set the ReadWriteListener.Type of the write to perform. This is here in the case that the characteristic you are writing to has more than one write type associated with it eg. BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_NO_RESPONSE, BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_SIGNED along with standard writes.

      • setBytes

        public final BleWrite.Builder setBytes​(byte[] data)
        Set the raw bytes to write.

      • setData

        public final BleWrite.Builder setData​(FutureData data)
        Set the FutureData to write.

      • setBoolean

        public final BleWrite.Builder setBoolean​(boolean value)
        Set the boolean to write.

      • setInt

        public final BleWrite.Builder setInt​(int val)
        Set an int to be written.

      • setShort

        public final BleWrite.Builder setShort​(short val)
        Set a short to be written.

      • setLong

        public final BleWrite.Builder setLong​(long val)
        Set a long to be written.

      • setString

        public final BleWrite.Builder setString​(java.lang.String value,
                                        java.lang.String stringEncoding)
        Set a string to be written. This method also allows you to specify the string encoding. If the encoding fails, then String.getBytes() is used instead, which uses "UTF-8" by default.

      • setString

        public final BleWrite.Builder setString​(java.lang.String value)
        Set a string to be written. This defaults to "UTF-8" encoding.

      • buildArray

        public final BleWrite[] buildArray()

      • setServiceUUID

        public final B setServiceUUID​(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the service UUID for this operation. This is only needed when you have characteristics with identical uuids under different services.

      • setCharacteristicUUID

        public final B setCharacteristicUUID​(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the characteristic UUID.

      • setReadWriteListener

        public final B setReadWriteListener​(ReadWriteListener listener)
        Set the ReadWriteListener for listening to the callback of the operation you wish to perform.

      • setDescriptorFilter

        public final B setDescriptorFilter​(DescriptorFilter filter)
        Set the DescriptorFilter to determine which characteristic to operate on, if there are multiple with the same UUID in the same BluetoothGattService.

      • next

        public final B next()
        Move on to another BleRead instance, based on the last one (so if you only need to change the char UUID, you don't have to set all other fields again).

      • nextNew

        public final B nextNew()
        Move on to another BleRead instance, with the new instance having no fields set.

      • build

        public final java.util.List<T> build()
        Builds, and returns the list of BleReads.
